intro: Cyrtandra infera, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane rainforests. Cyrtandra infera has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
